ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Is selos in a group a megataunt?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hahaha!  I was in Mistmoore this weekend too and it was CRAZY!  I never fought there with my shaman and I m really enjoying myself (despite the multiple
ygData.messageBody:
Hahaha! I was in Mistmoore this weekend too and it was CRAZY! I never
fought there with my shaman and I'm really enjoying myself (despite the
multiple deaths) because the whacked out pathing makes it challenging.

Only advice I have is get a druid to group wtih you. Once they cast that
damage shield on you, the mobs don't give a FIG about you! They just start
pounding the wimpy druid *snicker*.

Tani, 21st (oh, sorry sweetie, I really am trying to taunt) Bard

-----Original Message-----
From: Elijah Meeker [mailto:elijah@...]
Sent: Saturday, March 25, 2000 9:31 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Is selos in a group a megataunt?


From: "Elijah Meeker" <elijah@...>

I have gotten in two *good* yard groups in Mistmoore the last two nights,
which I hear is rare, but I have been doing well. I like to keep Selos going
(with drum) in case one of the clockwork trains catches us and we have to
zone (in fact the warriors were routinly /following me during breaks just in
case). One thing I noticed was if something spawned or someone else pulled
something it headed right for me even if they started wacking it before it
arrived to begin pummeling me. Assuming it wasn't my breath, does anyone
else notice this?

Tszaaz
